meanings.definition: Accustomed to something difficult or painful.
meanings.sent1: The enured soldier faced the harsh conditions without complaint.
meanings.sent2: She was enured to the long hours and hard work required for the job.
meanings.sent3: The enured hiker laughed in the face of the challenging mountain trail.
meanings.sent4: His enured heart could withstand any emotional turmoil.
meanings.sent5: The enured athlete's determination was unwavering in the face of adversity.

meanings.definition: To make someone accustomed to something difficult or painful.
meanings.sent1: The tough training enured the recruits to the rigors of military life.
meanings.sent2: She enured her body to the intense physical demands of the sport.
meanings.sent3: The coach enured the team to early morning practices with a sense of humor.
meanings.sent4: His mentor enured him to the challenges of leadership through tough lessons.
meanings.sent5: The teacher enured her students to the importance of hard work and perseverance.
